articles.title: Ben Ferencz: Last surviving Nuremberg prosecutor dies, aged 103 - BBC
articles.description: Ben Ferencz was just 27 when he convicted 22 Nazi officials for war crimes and crimes against humanity.
articles.content:
The last surviving prosecutor from the post-World War Two Nuremberg trials has died aged 103.
Ben Ferencz was just 27 when he secured the convictions of 22 Nazi officers for war crimes and crimes ag… [+2867 chars]

articles.title: Cancer-stricken scientist who created first antibiotic type in 40 years may die before Nobel Prize - Daily Mail
articles.description: Kirsty Smitten (pictured), 28, harbours fantasies of one day collecting a Nobel Prize for her scientific work - and rightly so, given that it could save millions of lives and avert a medical catastrophe.
